RACE.RACE_TEXT: West Virginia Vincent Moscarelli Memorial Breeders' Classic S. CHARLES TOWN RACE 1 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 89. Stakes Purse 75000. FOR TWO YEARS OLD. Purse $75,000. After payment of 10% of purse in nominator awards, purse to be divided 50% to the winner, 22% to second, 11% to third, 7% to fourth, 5% to fifth and 1% to sixth through 10th. Weight: 120 lbs. Nominations close Wednesday, October 4, 2022. Field limited to ten starters with up to four alternates. Preference to those horses having accumulated the highest career earnings at time of closing of entries.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: JUBAWITHATWIST stalked from the three path on the opening turn, started a bid approaching the three eighths pole and reached even terms past the quarter, raced with a slim disadvantage leaving the far turn but dug in for the lead inside the sixteenth pole and edged clear the final yards. KING KONTIE rated a slim lead inside, came under pressure toward the three eighths pole and was met at even terms leaving the quarter, dug in from the head of the lane but was caught inside the sixteenth pole and relented in the final yards. GRANDY stalked from the four path the first turn, gave chase nearing the three eighths pole, rounded the far turn off the rail then flattened in the lane. LOVE IS WICKED saved ground on the first turn, bid leaving the seven sixteenths pole and raced at the rail on the far turn, eased outward toward mid-stretch and passed some rivals. SOUL CATCHER saved ground, picked up the chase nearing the three eighths pole, raced at the rail on the far turn and showed little in the lane. POWERED BY LOVE stalked off the rail, gave chase approaching the three eighths pole, rounded the far turn about the three path but showed little more. RACING HOT LINE settled off the rail on the first turn, gave chase past the seven sixteenths pole but showed little response.

ENTRY.NAME: Love Is Wicked
ENTRY.COMMENT: saved ground,bid 7/16,rail far turn,eased out 1/16,passed rivals

ENTRY.NAME: Powered by Love
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked off rail,chased 3/8,3p far turn,empty lane

RACE.RACE_TEXT: West Virginia Department of Tourism Breeders' Classic S. CHARLES TOWN RACE 2 7F Dirt CR: 88. Stakes Purse 75000. FOR FILLIES THREE YEARS OLD. Purse $75,000. After payment of 10% of purse in nominator awards, purse to be divided 50% to the winner, 22% to second, 11% to third, 7% to fourth, 5% to fifth and 1% to sixth through 10th. Weight: 122 lbs. Nominations close W ednesday, October 4, 2023. Field limited to ten starters with up to four alternates. Preference to those horses having accumulated the highest career earnings at time of closing of entries.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: JUBASLILBALLERINA stalked from the three path, started a bid approaching the three eighths pole and took the nod two deep midway on the far turn, dueled clear nearing mid-stretch and held well under steady handling. LUCKY BLONDE settled off the rail on the first turn, bid nearing the three eighths pole, raced off the rail on the far turn and came along to take second the final strides. MAGGIE'S GIRL took over leaving the thirteen sixteenths pole and moved to the inside to rate the pace, came under pressure passing the three eighths pole, was met at the rail midway on the far turn, dropped back toward mid-stretch and flattened later yards. JUBA'S PARADE raced off the rail on the opening turn, picked up the chase nearing the three eighths pole, rounded the far turn in the four path and showed little further. MARINA GRANDE raced in the three and four paths on the first turn, left the turn outside and gave chase toward the three eighths pole, rounded the far turn two deep and showed little in the lane. BARBERS POINT saved ground, picked up the chase leaving the three eighths pole but weakened at the rail on the far turn. POLISH THE DIAMOND rounded the first turn in the four path and showed little response through the backstretch.

ENTRY.NAME: Maggie's Girl
ENTRY.COMMENT: rated pace inside,pressured 3/8,met rail mid turn,flattened 1/16

ENTRY.NAME: Marina Grande
ENTRY.OWNER: Jay A Reese LLC and Hatter Edgar

ENTRY.NAME: Lucky Blonde
ENTRY.COMMENT: off rail,bid 3/8,off rail far turn,along 2nd late

RACE.RACE_TEXT: West Virginia Lottery Breeders' Classic S. CHARLES TOWN RACE 3 7F Dirt CR: 89. Stakes Purse 75000. FOR THREE YEARS OLD. Purse $75,000. After payment of 10% of purse in nominator awards, purse to be divided 50% to the winner, 22% to second, 11% to third, 7% to fourth, 5% to fifth and 1% to sixth through 10th. Weight: 122 lbs. Nominations close Wednesday , October 4, 2023. Field limited to ten starters with up to four alternates. Preference to those horses having accumulated the highest career earnings at time of closing of entries.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: JUBA'S HAT TRICK stalked from the three path on the opening turn, started a bid leaving the three eighths pole and took the lead three wide approaching the quarter pole, dug in under steady encouragement leaving the far turn and held on well. LORD OF CORK broke a step slow then saved ground on the first turn, gave chase into the backstretch, improved four wide on the far turn but was outfinished in the duel through the stretch. JUBA'S NOTION settled off the rail the first turn, picked up the chase leaving the seven sixteenths pole, rounded the far turn about the three path then flattened toward mid-stretch. STROLLINGINTHEWIND saved ground well off the pace, bid past the seven sixteenths pole but was blocked at the rail on the far turn and flattened stride the final sixteenth. HONEYQUIST took a quick lead and moved to the inside to rate the pace, was met into the backstretch, came under pressure leaving the three eighths pole, gave up the lead toward the quarter and weakened in the stretch. PAYMENGOLD rated close inside on the first turn, gave chase leaving the three eighths pole but weakened at the rail into the far turn. GRUMPY'S BUDDY raced in the four path the first turn, picked up the chase from the seven sixteenths pole but showed little response. DUNCAN IDAHO stalked off the rail, moved to even terms into the backstretch and gave chase from the three eighths pole, but weakened off the rail on the far turn. SUMMONING DENIS raced off the rail on the first turn and never factored. JAZZ WITH DENIS settled in the three path the first turn and was not a factor.

ENTRY.NAME: Honeyquist
ENTRY.OWNER: Mammas Boys Thoroughbred Racing Group LLC Ultra Championship Racing LLC and Mill

ENTRY.NAME: Lord of Cork
ENTRY.COMMENT: step slow break,saved ground,chased 1/2,4wd far turn,outfinished

RACE.RACE_TEXT: West Virginia Triple Crown Nutrition Breeders' Classic S. CHARLES TOWN RACE 4 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 75. Stakes Purse 75000. FOR FILLIES TWO YEARS OLD. Purse $75,000. After payment of 10% of purse in nominator awards, purse to be divided 50% to the winner, 22% to second, 11% to third, 7% to fourth, 5% to fifth and 1% to sixth through 10th. Weight: 120 lbs. Nominations close Wed nesday, October 4, 2023. Field limited to ten starters with up to four alternates. Preference to those horses having accumulated the highest career earnings at time of closing of entries.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: DIRECT THE CAT rated a slim lead inside on the first turn, was asked approaching the three eighths pole and drew away at the rail on the far turn then mostly hand ridden in the lane. RAN OUT OF TRAINER stalked off the rail the first turn, gave chase nearing the three eighths pole, raced in the three path on the far turn, dug in down the lane and just lasted for second. RUNAWAY BEAUTY raced off the pace in the three path the first turn, gave chase nearing the three eighths pole, angled to the five path on the far turn and ran evenly through the lane. KRISTINACHRYSALIS rounded the first turn in the five path, gave chase nearing the three eighths pole, raced in the five path on the far turn and passed rivals in the lane. SEVEN NATTY PATTY rated close inside on the first turn, gave chase nearing the three eighths pole, rounded the far turn about the four path and showed little more. NAVY BAND stalked in the four path the first turn, gave chase approaching the three eighths pole, rounded the far turn at the rail and weakened in the lane. MAMA MARGE stalked the early pace two deep, gave chase nearing the three eighths pole, rounded the far turn off the rail and weakened. MAKANI raced off the rail on the first turn then eased out into the backstretch and gave chase past the seven sixteenths pole, but weakened into the far turn. ILIKEFUNSIZE raced in the five path the first turn and showed little response through the backstretch.

ENTRY.NAME: Seven Natty Patty
ENTRY.OWNER: Baccari Racing Stable LLC and Dream Walkin Farms Inc
ENTRY.COMMENT: rated close inside,chased 3/8,4p far turn,little further

ENTRY.NAME: Ilikefunsize
ENTRY.OWNER: Burnsworth Richard and Five Hellions Farm

ENTRY.NAME: Mama Marge
ENTRY.OWNER: O'Sullivan Farms LLC and Contreras Javier

ENTRY.NAME: Direct the Cat
ENTRY.COMMENT: rated slim lead,asked 3/8,widened rail turn,hand ridden lane

RACE.RACE_TEXT: West Virginia Thoroughbred Breeders Association Onion Juice Breed CHARLES TOWN RACE 5 7F Dirt CR: 101. Stakes Purse 75000. FOR THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD. Purse $75,000. After payment of 10% of purse in nominator awards, purse to be divided 50% to the winner, 22% to second, 11% to third, 7% to fourth, 5% to fifth and 1% to sixth through 10th. Weight: Three Year Olds, 120 lbs. ; Older, 123 lbs. Nominations close Wednesday, October 4, 2023. Field limited to ten starters with up to four alternates. Preference to those horses having accumulated the highest 2022-23 earnings at time of closing of entries.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: NO CHANGE settled back in the three path the first turn, started a bid nearing the three eighths pole, swept to the lead three wide midway on the far turn and was kept sharp in the stretch. SOCIAL CHIC rated off the pace inside, bid leaving the seven sixteenths pole and rounded the turn in the three and four paths, left the turn outside and dug in to take second the final strides. REMYS SHOWTIME stalked two deep early and moved to even terms approaching the half mile pole, dueled from the seven sixteenths, raced off the rail on the far turn and flattened stride the final sixteenth. JUNGLE BEAST settled off the rail on the first turn, gave chase nearing the three eighths pole, raced in the four path on the far turn and showed little in the lane. ROAD PARTY rated the early pace inside, was met toward the half mile pole and dueled at even terms from the seven sixteenths, but dropped back at the rail midway on the far turn and weakened in the stretch. FANCY CONCHO raced two deep on the first turn, gave chase past the seven sixteenths pole but faded approaching the far turn.

ENTRY.NAME: Social Chic
ENTRY.COMMENT: off pace inside,bid 7/16,3& 4p far turn,up 2nd final strides

ENTRY.NAME: Jungle Beast
ENTRY.COMMENT: off rail,chased 3/8,4p far turn,little in lane

ENTRY.NAME: No Change
ENTRY.COMMENT: settled 3p 1st turn,bid 3/8,up 3wd mid turn,kept sharp lane

RACE.RACE_TEXT: West Virginia Dash for Cash Breeders' Classic S. Presented by ROC CHARLES TOWN RACE 6 4 1/2F Dirt CR: 96. Stakes Purse 75000. FOR THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD. Purse $75,000. After payment of 10% of purse in nominator awards, purse to be divided 50% to the winner, 22% to second, 11% to third, 7% to fourth, 5% to fifth and 1% to sixth through 10th. Weight: Three Year Olds, 120 lbs. ; Older, 123 lbs. Nominations close Wednesday, October 4, 2023. Field limited to ten starters with up to four alternates. Preference to those horses having accumulated the highest 2022-23 earnings at time of closing of entries.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: PENGUIN POWER chased outside, raced five wide on the turn, dug in under steady stretch handling to take the lead in later yards and raced clear under the wire. YOUTHINKTHATSFUNNY chased outside, rounded the turn about the six path, left the turn outside and closed well to take second the final strides. GOLDEN KEY was hustled to the lead past the half mile pole and set a pressured pace, raced at the rail on the turn, was steadily handled leaving the turn but gave up the lead in later yards and flattened nearing the wire. EL LUCERITO chased through the backstretch, raced near the rail on the turn and flattened inside the eighth pole. NICO became a bit anxious in the gate then gave chase, rounded the turn about the three path, eased outward leaving the turn and finished evenly to pass rivals. TEACHINTHERELEASE was fractious in the gate, gave chase through the backstretch, raced in the four path on the turn then flattened in the lane. DERBY DAY DREAMS chased inside, raced near the rail on the turn and showed little in the stretch. JEFFERSON NATIVE became extremely fractious and sat down in the gate, pressured the early pace but faded off the rail on the turn. LITTLE ROO ROO broke a step slow then gave chase, lacked a clear path in the three path on the turn and was not asked further.

ENTRY.NAME: Little Roo Roo
ENTRY.COMMENT: step slow,chased,lacked room 3p turn,not asked lane

ENTRY.NAME: El Lucerito
ENTRY.OWNER: Campbell Marshall T and Bentley Donald L

ENTRY.NAME: Nico
ENTRY.COMMENT: anxious in gate,chased,3p turn,eased out 1/8,even finish

ENTRY.NAME: Golden Key
ENTRY.COMMENT: hustled up,set pressured pace,rail turn,caught late,flattened

ENTRY.NAME: Jefferson Native
ENTRY.COMMENT: fractious,sat in gate,pressured early pace,faded off rail turn

ENTRY.NAME: Penguin Power
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased outside,5wd turn,dug in lane,up late,clear wire

RACE.RACE_TEXT: West Virginia Cavada Breeders' Classic S. CHARLES TOWN RACE 7 7F Dirt CR: 89. Stakes Purse 125000. FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD. Purse $125,000. After payment of 10% of purse in nominator awards, purse to be divided 50% to the winner, 22% to second, 11% to third, 7% to fourth, 5% to fifth and 1% to sixth through 10th. Weight: Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 123 lbs. Nominations close Wednesday, October 4, 2022. Field limited to ten starters with up to four alternates. Preference to those horses having accumulated the highest 2022-23 earnings at time of closing of entries.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: HESSICA settled off the rail on the first turn, started a bid leaving the seven sixteenths pole and improved in the three path on the far turn, took the lead three wide entering the stretch, dueled clear mid-stretch and widened through later yards. LUCYLOU WHO stalked three wide on the opening turn, picked up the chase toward the three eighths pole and took a brief slim lead two deep midway on the far turn, but was met entering the stretch, dropped back toward mid-stretch and flattened later yards. THE SKY IS FALLING raced off the rail on the first turn, gave chase nearing the seven sixteenths pole, rounded the far turn off the rail and showed little more. FULL MOON LOVER rated a slim lead inside, came under pressure nearing the three eighths pole, was met at the rail past the quarter and weakened leaving the turn. MOONLIT SHADOW raced in the three path the first turn, gave chase from the seven sixteenths pole, rounded the far turn in the three path and weakened. AIM'S JUBILEE saved ground on the first turn and showed little response through the backstretch. MISS WAVE raced inside and showed little response. FOXY SISTA stalked the early pace two deep, gave chase leaving the seven sixteenths pole but faded at the rail on the far turn.

ENTRY.NAME: Full Moon Lover
ENTRY.OWNER: Brown Nicole and Brown Ronney W
ENTRY.COMMENT: rated slim lead,pressured 3/8,met rail past 1/4,weakened lane

ENTRY.NAME: The Sky Is Falling
ENTRY.COMMENT: settled off rail,chased 7/16,off rail far turn,flattened

RACE.RACE_TEXT: Sam Huff West Virginia Breeders' Classic S. CHARLES TOWN RACE 8 1 1/8M Dirt CR: 105. Stakes Purse 300000. FOR THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD. Purse $300,000. After payment of 10% of purse in nominator awards, purse to be divided 50% to the winner, 22% to second, 11% to third, 7% to fourth, 5% to fifth and 1% to sixth through 10th. Weight: Three Year Olds, 120 lbs .; Older, 123 lbs. Nominations close Wednesday, October 4, 2023. Field limited to ten starters with up to four alternates. Preference to those horses having accumulated the highest 2022-23 earnings at time of closing of entries.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: COASTAL MISSION took over into the first turn and rated the pace off the rail, pulled away at the rail on the far turn and was kept on the bit through the lane. MUAD'DIB settled in the four path off the pace, crept closer leaving the nine sixteenths pole, bid passing the three eighths pole, raced in the three path on the far turn and dueled for second. LATE IN THE GAME saved ground just off the early pace, gave chase from the seven sixteenths pole, rounded the far turn near the rail and came along for third later yards. C R'S MANDATE settled in the four path, gave chase past the seven sixteenths pole, rounded the far turn near the rail and flattened stride leaving the eighth pole. CANDY INVASION raced in the four path early, gave chase past the seven sixteenths pole, rounded the far turn near the rail and showed little more. MARTIN MAN settled back toward the inside, gave chase leaving the seven sixteenths pole, rounded the far turn in the four path and weakened. NOBALLSTWOSTRIKES raced well back inside early on and showed little response through the backstretch. BUFF'S EYE VIEW was through after a half mile. RIP THORN rated close to the early pace in the three path, gave chase past the seven sixteenths pole but weakened at the rail into the far turn. TYRY TYRANNOSAURUS stalked the early pace inside then faded through the backstretch.

ENTRY.NAME: Coastal Mission
ENTRY.COMMENT: rated pace off rail,pulled away rail far turn,kept on bit lane

ENTRY.NAME: Martin Man
ENTRY.OWNER: A and B Racing Stable LLC

ENTRY.NAME: Late in the Game
ENTRY.COMMENT: saved ground,chased 7/16,rail far turn,along 3rd later yards

ENTRY.NAME: Candy Invasion
ENTRY.COMMENT: 4p 1st turn,chased past 7/16,rail far turn,little in lane

ENTRY.NAME: Muad'dib
ENTRY.COMMENT: off pace 4p,crept closer from 9/16,bid 3/8,3p far turn,dueled 2nd

RACE.RACE_TEXT: West Virginia Roger Ramey Breeders Classic Distaff S. Presented b CHARLES TOWN RACE 9 1 1/8M Dirt CR: 79. Stakes Purse 75000. FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD. Purse $75,000. After payment of 10% of purse in nominator awards, purse to be divided 50% to the winner, 22% to second, 11% to third, 7% to fourth, 5% to fifth and 1% to sixth through 10th. Weight: Three Y ear Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 123 lbs. Nominations close Wednesday, October 4, 2023. Field limited to ten starters with up to four alternates. Preference to those horses having accumulated the highest 2022-23 earnings at time of closing of entries.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: SOMEDAY IS TODAY settled in the four path then stalked leaving the second turn, bid approaching the three eighths pole, took the lead two deep midway on the far turn, raced clear toward the head of the lane and held well under steady stretch encouragement. NO DENYING DENIS rated close to the early pace inside, picked up the chase from the seven sixteenths pole and raced in the three path on the far turn, dug in leaving the turn and came along for second the final strides. SENECA ROCKS raced well back from early contention, started a bid leaving the three eighths pole, improved in the five path on the far turn and came along to take third the final strides. JUBA BABY raced in the five path early then stalked from the three path into the second turn, gave chase nearing the seven sixteenths pole, took the lead at the three eighths pole but was met at the rail midway on the far turn and flattened in the duel through the stretch. AZZURRA settled in the four path early on, started a bid leaving the half mile pole and raced in range of the lead in the three path on the far turn, but flattened in the lane. BREADMAN'S ROSEBUD raced in the four path early and bid only mildly from the three eighths pole. REVEIRS MINUTE stalked off the rail then took a brief lead at the nine sixteenths pole, was caught toward the three eighths and weakened into the far turn. CRUZ IN THE CASTLE set the early pace inside, was met nearing the nine sixteenths pole and gave chase from that point, but dropped back past the three eighths and weakened at the rail into the far turn. OCEAN LILLY showed little response through the backstretch. JAMESTOWN ROAD was through after three quarters.

ENTRY.NAME: Reveirs Minute
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked off rail,nod 9/16,caught 3/8,weakened into far turn

ENTRY.NAME: dh-Cruz in the Castle
ENTRY.COMMENT: early pace inside,met 9/16,chased,weakened rail into far turn

ENTRY.NAME: No Denying Denis
ENTRY.COMMENT: rated close inside,chased 7/16,3p far turn,along 2nd final strdes

ENTRY.NAME: Someday Is Today
ENTRY.COMMENT: settled 4p,stalked 1/2,bid near 3/8,up 2d mid turn,held well drvg

WINNERS_DETAILS.BREEDER: Schiano Racing Inc. & Carpe Diem Syndicate

ENTRY.NAME: Juba Baby
ENTRY.OWNER: Two Ten Twelve Triple T Racing

RACE.RACE_TEXT: Blue and Gold S. CHARLES TOWN RACE 10 4 1/2F Dirt CR: 90. Stakes Purse 75000. FOR REGISTERED ACCREDITED WEST VIRGINIA BRED FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD. $50 nominations close Wednesday, October 4, 2023. $50 to enter with a purse of $75,000 Added. Entries close Wednesday, October 11, 2023 by the usual time of closing . The added monies and all fees to be divided 60% to the winner, 20% to second, 11% to third, 6% to fourth, and 3% to fifth. Weight: Three Years Old 120 lbs.; Older 123 lbs. Field will be limited to ten starters with up to four alternates. Preference to t hose horses having accumulated the highest 2022-2023 earnings at the time of closing of entries. Trophy to the winning owner.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: COACH RUBE chased inside, rounded the turn at the rail, dug in for the lead just inside the sixteenth pole and edged clear later yards. FANCY HER UP was hustled to the lead approaching the half mile pole and set a pressured pace, rounded the turn near the rail, was met passing the sixteenth pole and flattened stride later yards, but managed to hold onto second. GREAT SPIRIT gave chase, rounded the turn about the six path and was outfinished in the stretch duel for second. BELLA MELA engaged in close chase through the backstretch, raced in the five path on the turn and ran evenly down the lane. MANAROLA chased through the backstretch, rounded the turn off the rail, angled to the six path approaching the head of the lane and finished evenly outside. STRYDA pressured the pace but dropped back past the quarter pole, continued close in the three path on the turn but weakened the final sixteenth. MACKENZIE'S MUSIC chased through the backstretch, raced two deep on the turn then flattened from mid-stretch. JUBA'S HOUSE chased outside, raced in the six path on the turn and showed little in the lane. GHOSTLY SQUALL raced well back while saving ground and was eased in the stretch.

ENTRY.NAME: Coach Rube
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased inside,rail turn,up inside 1/16,edged clear later yards

ENTRY.NAME: Fancy Her Up
ENTRY.COMMENT: hustled to lead,rail turn,met passing 1/16,flattened,held on 2nd
